alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Debeque to Silt Corridor (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued May 19 at 9:57PM MDT until May 21 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 29 possible. * WHERE...Central Colorado River Basin and Debeque to Silt Corridor. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Central Colorado River Basin; Debeque to Silt Corridor
